intro: Pilosella pseudopilosella, commonly known as the slender pilosella, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry meadows and rocky habitats. Pilosella pseudopilosella is notable for its distinctive appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
